projects.name: GoodHood (Current Volunteer Project)
projects.description: React-based data visualization website to help potential house buyers make informed decisions about the local neighborhood and area they wish to move. I am coordinating directly with the project lead on this, including bug fixes, implementing features, and partaking in code reviews. My contributions so far have been creating and modifying authentication interfaces, and developing data pipelines in Python using Pandas for creation of school quality metrics using test scores of Virginia schools. My current future planned improvements are to generalize the data pipelines to the whole country's schools, as well as to implement testing code using React's TestingLibrary.

projects.name: Memory Card Game
projects.description: Simple card game written using React and Typescript. Deals a hand of cards for the user to click, and the user must click a different card each hand to win. Clicking the same card twice in one game is a loss. Card images and details fetched using async/await from PokeAPI.

projects.name: Wardrobe Whiz
projects.description: Mock website capable of CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) and asyncronous API calls to shopping websites for creating outfits. Written in HTML, CSS, and JS with Bootstrap and passes accessibility checks.

projects.name: Personal Website
projects.description: My personal website (the one that you are on currently!) hosted using GitHub Pages. Written by hand using React.

projects.name: Hotel Database
projects.description: Mock SQL-based database written with a front-end in Python. Created to be able to manage the database for a fictional hotel chain including managing rooms, reservations, employees, billing, and services.

projects.name: LLM Embedding
projects.description: Machine learning model for embeddings written in Python using Keras and Tensorflow and trained on the HuggingFace Wikipedia dataset. It was trained using the same method as GLoVe.

projects.name: Spreadterm
projects.description: TUI-based spreadsheet application written in Rust and ncurses.

projects.name: Rimplex
projects.description: Java Swing-based calculator capable of processing and handling complex numbers. Written in three mock Agile/Scrum sprints.
